panels.description: The average per-second number of records produced/polled (before transformation) by this task belonging to the named source connector in this worker.
panels.title: Source Record Poll rate

panels.description: The average number of records that have been produced by this task but not yet completely written to Kafka.
panels.title: Source Record Active Count average

panels.description: The maximum number of records that have been produced by this task but not yet completely written to Kafka.
panels.title: Source Record Active Count max

panels.description: The average per-second number of records output from the transformations and written to Kafka for this task belonging to the named source connector in this worker. This is after transformations are applied and excludes any records filtered out by the transformations.
panels.title: Source Record Write rate

panels.description: Before transformations are applied, this is the number of records produced or polled by the task belonging to the named source connector in the worker (since the task was last restarted)
panels.title: Record Poll Total

panels.description: The number of topic partitions assigned to this task belonging to the named sink connector in this worker.
panels.title: Partition Count

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds taken by this task to put a batch of sinks records
panels.title: Put Batch Average time

panels.description: The maximum time in milliseconds taken by this task to put a batch of sinks records
panels.title: Put Batch Max time

panels.description: The average number of bytes sent per partition per-request.
panels.title: Batch Size Average

panels.title: Record Size Average

panels.description: The average number of records sent per second.

panels.description: The average number of records per request.
panels.title: Records Per Request Average

panels.description: The average number of batch splits per second.
panels.title: Producer Split Rate

panels.description: The average number of bytes fetched per request.
panels.title: Consumer Fetch Size Average

panels.description: The average number of bytes consumed per second.

panels.description: The average number of records consumed per second.

panels.description: The average number of records in each request.
panels.title: Records Per Request Average

panels.description:
current-scn:
The most recent system change number that has been processed.

offset-scn:	
The most recent system change number stored in the connector offsets topic.

logmining-session-end-scn:
The end system change number of the most recent LogMiner session (end SCN is -1 in case of continuous mining).

logmining-session-redo-log-files:
The set of redo log files included in the most recent LogMiner session.

oldest-scn-in-buffer:
The system change number of oldest transaction in the transaction buffer. (Available only when record.buffer.mode is set to connector)
panels.title: SCNs

panels.description: The latency between when the database change was made and when the redo task completed processing this change. It is measured as the difference (in milliseconds) between the timestamp associated with the redo producer record and the timestamp from the redo record for the database change. Clock differences between the database and connect servers are accounted for in the calculation of this metric.
panels.title: streaming-lag-from-source-in-milliseconds

panels.description:
count-active-transactions-in-buffer: 
The count of active transactions in the transaction buffer. 

count-processed-transactions-in-cache:
The count of processed transactions in the recently processed transactions cache. (Available only when record.buffer.mode is set to connector)

(Available only when record.buffer.mode is set to connector)
panels.title: Transactions

panels.description: The age (milliseconds) of the oldest transaction in the transaction buffer. This is the difference between the current database timestamp and the start timestamp of the oldest transaction in the transaction buffer. A high value that keeps increasing can be due to a long running transaction that is ongoing or due to an increased streaming lag from the source. (Available only when record.buffer.mode is set to connector)
panels.title: age-of-oldest-transaction-in-buffer-in-milliseconds

panels.description: The identifier of the oldest transaction in the transaction buffer. (Available only when record.buffer.mode is set to connector)
panels.title: oldest-transaction-id-in-buffer
